alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 2:26PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Lake and central Volusia Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 225 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Salt Springs to 7 miles north of Pierson to 6 miles west of Daytona International Speedway. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Deltona, Daytona Beach, Port Orange, DeLand and New Smyrna Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors! These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Volusia; Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County
